evidence: Graphene has an interesting property: it can absorb light energy and convert it into heat.
The NIR pulsed laser excites graphene microbubbles, which then generate acoustic waves via thermal expansion.

triples.evidence: Once these microbubbles are introduced, they enhance the ultrasound signal because the presence of microbubbles makes acoustic reflections stronger.
